definition: full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
to lean against the railings and look at the moon (idiom)

sentences.english: Now, one family is sitting in front of the door to enjoy the cool, chat, full moon, eat moon cakes.
sentences.chinese: 此刻，一家人正坐在門前乘涼，聊天，望月，喫月餅。

sentences.english: The sun for the day; the moon for the night; and you forever.
sentences.chinese: 白日見光，深夜望月，懷你卻永恆。

sentences.english: Moon water, glittering, slightly elongated shadow is the lake.
sentences.chinese: 望月水中，波光粼粼，微微月影被湖面拉長。

sentences.english: On the other hand, the full moon to announce the climbing frame subduct decision.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，望月向大家宣佈要把攀登架撤去的決定。

sentences.english: Only a short while ago, no longer looked Mochizuki. ?
sentences.chinese: 曾幾何時，不再擡頭望月了呢？

sentences.english: Moon-looking village site was the last inhabiting place of tribe of Ba Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 此望月村遺址是巴人部落的最後棲息地。

sentences.english: There was one where a young lady was at a window looking up at the moon.
sentences.chinese: 還有一張，畫着個年青的姑娘，靠在窗前，擡頭望月。

definition: bright moon/refers to 夜明珠, a legendary pearl that can glow in the dark/CL:輪|轮[lun2]
to go for a walk in the moonlight
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
Palace in the Moon (in folk tales)
the other end of the world/a faraway place
late at night/in the dead of night
